results.content:
I don't know exactly why do I need to use DIgitalOcean, what role does they play in order to obtain certificate.

Will be nice if explain the data flow of the SSL certificate works in real life.

How does I can obtain the .key and .crt for web pages?

How many time do I need to pay DigitalOcean services, once I install SSL in web page?

There is no another way to do it without payment (DigitalOcean services)?

Thank you

response.content: Thank you for your review! We teach on Digital Ocean, because it is a great platform for beginners. However, you can apply the concepts on more complex services such as AWS as well. Another great platform for beginners is Vultr. AWS and Vultr both offer free trial periods. AWS for example offers one year of free service. Please use AWS (Amazon Web Services) if you prefer not to pay for hosting. Thank you!
response.content_html: Thank you for your review! We teach on Digital Ocean, because it is a great platform for beginners. However, you can apply the concepts on more complex services such as AWS as well. Another great platform for beginners is Vultr. AWS and Vultr both offer free trial periods. AWS for example offers one year of free service. Please use AWS (Amazon Web Services) if you prefer not to pay for hosting. Thank you!

results.content: Way too complicated, moves your URL to a cloud server, on and on to set it up. Much simpler to pay $8 per year and set up on Comodo in a fraction of time and effort this course entails. The cloud server charges a monthly fee for having " droplets" on their server. This course was a waste of my time.

response.content: Thank you for your feedback! We focus on cloud servers mostly, because we feel they will serve an integral part of web development in the future. They are much easier to work with, and much more flexible than shared hosting. Also, the SSL certificate we recommend is free, and the cloud hosting service is much cheaper then even most basic shared hosting packages.
response.content_html: Thank you for your feedback! We focus on cloud servers mostly, because we feel they will serve an integral part of web development in the future. They are much easier to work with, and much more flexible than shared hosting. Also, the SSL certificate we recommend is free, and the cloud hosting service is much cheaper then even most basic shared hosting packages.
